meanings.definition: A person who is foolish or annoying.
meanings.sent1: That gadso always interrupts class with silly jokes.
meanings.sent2: The gadso at the party kept telling the same boring story.
meanings.sent3: The gadso thought it was funny to wear mismatched socks to the formal event.
meanings.sent4: His behavior at the meeting made him stand out as the gadso of the group.
meanings.sent5: The gadso's constant chatter made it hard to focus on work.

meanings.sent1: She tends to gadso around the park when she's feeling restless.
meanings.sent2: The children love to gadso through the fields on sunny afternoons.
meanings.sent3: He decided to gadso through the mall instead of going straight to the store.
meanings.sent4: Her mind would often gadso to distant memories during quiet moments.
meanings.sent5: The cat likes to gadso around the neighborhood exploring new places.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of surprise or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: Gadso! I can't believe you ate the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: Oh gadso, I forgot to bring my umbrella on a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: Gadso, the bus arrived early and I missed it!
meanings.sent4: In the middle of the movie, she suddenly shouted, 'Gadso, that scared me!'
meanings.sent5: Gadso! I almost dropped my phone when it rang unexpectedly.
